intro: Polyachyrus foliosus, commonly known as the leafy polyachyrus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several tiny, elliptical seeds.
